meanings.meaning: blow somebody/something out of the water
smash, blow, etc. something to smithereens

examples.korean: He knocked my head off. 발음듣기 저 놈이 내 머리를 박살 낸 거라구. YBM All in All English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He knocked my head off. 발음

examples.korean: My sister will go nuts[throw a fit] when she finds out I've wrecked her car. 발음듣기 내가 자기 차를 박살 낸 것을 알면 내 여동생이 지랄할 것이다 Neungyule
examples.english: My sister will go nuts[throw a fit] when she finds out I've wrecked her car. 발음

examples.korean: Everything that I destroyed, it can be repaired. 발음듣기 내가 박살낸 모든 것들은 수리될 수 있다. User translation Inaccurate information may be included due to the users' self-traslation. 메르베이(psys****) Web Collection
examples.english: Everything that I destroyed, it can be repaired. 발음

examples.korean: I’ve known people who have been sacked when it’s been discovered that they are pagans and others have had their windows smashed by neighbours. 발음듣기 이단이라는 것이 밝혀져 해고된 사람들, 이웃이 창문을 박살낸 사람들에 대해 익히 알고 있다. User translation Inaccurate information may be included due to the users' self-traslation. hannah0218(hann****) Web Collection
examples.english: I’ve known people who have been sacked when it’s been discovered that they are pagans and others have had their windows smashed by neighbours. 발음

examples.korean: The avalanche forced its way down the mountain, crushing everything in its path. 발음듣기 그 눈사태는 산 아래로 밀고 내려가며 가는 길에 걸리는 모든 것을 박살내 버렸다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
